title: Suspects arrested over Kotahena shooting killed in police fire
byline: The two gunmen in the Kotahena shooting, who were arrested last night, have been shot dead by police when they allegedly tried to grab a gun and escape while being taken to recover hidden weapons.

title: Rainy conditions expected to enhance in next few days
byline: The Meteorology Department says the rainy weather conditions are expected to enhance over the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva, and Central provinces and in the Hambantota District for the next few days from February 24.

title: One person dead after bus catches fire in Anuradhapura
byline: A person has reportedly died after a bus transporting a group of individuals on a pilgrimage caught fire early this morning (22) near a rest house close to the Jetavanaramaya in the Udamaluwa Police Division.

title: Several trains cancelled on Kelani Valley line
byline: The Railway Department has announced that several trains services scheduled to operate on the Kelani Valley line today (22) and tomorrow (23) have been temporarily suspended due to ongoing maintenance work in the Pangiriwatta area.

title: World Bank praises Sri Lanka’s debt restructuring and 2025 Budget Plan
byline: The World Bank’s South Asia Regional Director, Prosperity Practice Group, Mr. Mathew Verghis has met with the Secretary to the Prime Minister, Mr. Pradeep Saputhanthri, at the Prime Minister’s Office.

title: Special press briefing on underworld activities and national security
byline: A special press briefing is currently underway to address issues related to the control of underworld gang conflicts and the security situation in the country.

title: Hotline to report criminal activities and firearms; Rs. 1 million reward for info on T56 rifles - Acting IGP
byline: Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya has revealed that a total of 58 organized criminal gangs and around 1,400 individuals associated with them have been identified across the country.

title: Court permits 72-hour detention of suspects in Middeniya triple murder
byline: The Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court has granted permission for the police to detain the three suspects arrested in connection with the recent triple murder in Middeniya, for 72 hours for further questioning.

title: Suspects in Ganemulla Sanjeewa murder to be detained for 90 days
byline: The Defence Ministry has approved a 90-day detention order to further question the suspected gunman involved in the killing of the notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samarathne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa”, and the van driver who transported him to Puttalam, according to Acting IGP Priyantha Weerasuriya.

title: Defence Secretary on action against ex-soldiers engaged in criminal activities
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal (Retired) Sampath Thuyacontha, has revealed it has been observed that there is a tendency of armed forces personnel with weapons training deserting the Tri-Forces to engage in criminal activities and to join underworld criminal gangs.

title: Security tightened in Western and Southern provinces - Acting IGP
byline: Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya stated that criminal activities in the Western and Southern provinces have increased.

title: India-Sri Lanka Ferry service resumes after two months
byline: The ferry service from Nagapattinam in India to Kankesanthurai in Sri Lanka resumed on Saturday (February 22) after two months, Indian media reported.

title: Two more including constable arrested over ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: Another two suspects in connection with the assassination of notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa.” have been remanded until March 07 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Defence Secretary on action against military deserters engaged in criminal activities
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal (Retired) Sampath Thuyacontha, has revealed it has been observed that there is a tendency of armed forces personnel with weapons training deserting the Tri-Forces to engage in criminal activities and to join underworld criminal gangs.

title: India-Sri Lanka Ferry service resumes after over two months
byline: The ferry service from Nagapattinam in India to Kankesanthurai in Sri Lanka resumed on Saturday (February 22) after more than two months, Indian media reported.

title: Gazette issued on amended list of banned organizations in Sri Lanka
byline: An Extraordinary Gazette notification has been issued amending the list of designated persons, groups and entities in Sri Lanka.

title: Chinese researchers find bat virus enters human cells via same pathway as COVID
byline: A newly discovered bat coronavirus uses the same cell-surface protein to gain entry into human cells as the SARS-CoV-2 virus that causes COVID-19, raising the possibility that it could someday spread to humans, Chinese researchers have reported.

title: Qatar’s Minister of State for Foreign Affairs meets Sri Lanka’s FM, Deputy FM
byline: Qatar’s Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Sultan bin Saad al-Muraikhi has called on the Sri Lankan Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Vijitha Herath in Colombo.

title: Govt to consider request to give opposition more representation in parliamentary committees
byline: The Secretary General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadeera, stated that a special ‘Party Leaders’ Meeting was held today (February 22) to discuss the request made by Opposition regarding increasing the representation of Opposition Members of Parliament in Parliamentary Committees.

title: 8 workers feared trapped as portion of canal tunnel in Telangana collapses
byline: At least eight people are feared trapped after a portion of the Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) tunnel near Domalapenta collapsed in Nagarkurnool district in India’s Telangana on Saturday morning.
